prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Fauquier County (Va.) Judgments and Office Judgments, 1829-1904 (bulk 1833-1904). Local government records collection, Fauquier County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court papers from Fauquier County under the accession numbers 22743, 37409 and 37410.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Fauquier County was formed in 1759 from Prince William County. The county was named for Francis Fauquier, lieutenant governor of Virginia from 1758-1768.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Fauquier County (Va.) Judgments and Office Judgments, 1829-1904 (bulk 1833-1904), contain civil cases in which justice was administered on the strictly formulated rules of common law. The majority of cases in this record series relate to matters of debt.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically. Cases filed within each box by month, year and drawer number.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Fauquier County Court Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm"

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: These records are located at the State Records Center. Contact Archives Research Services for access information, directions and hours.
